result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by Atty. Klein requesting to adjourn the 10/27/22 hearing.
Hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:45 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan A Aleman Jr in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Juan A Aleman Jr.  Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Klein provides an update; she is requesting a further proceedings in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:06 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Juan A Aleman Jr in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Juan A Aleman Jr.  Atty. Klein provides an update, she notes the defendant has a new case which he needs to be evaluated on and hopefully she will be appointed in that matter as well.  Based on that Atty. Klein requests just a further proceedings date about 2-3 weeks.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

10:14 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Juan A Aleman in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Klein provides an update, she has an offer but wants some additional time to negotiate with the State. Atty. Klein requests another further proceeedings in about 30 days.  No objection form the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Detainer Lift sent to: New Lisbon Correctional.
Received via fax from New Lisbon Correctional.
Hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:38 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Juan A Aleman in court by Zoom video means, in custody at New Lisbon Correctional, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Klein confirms she was just appointed, she has discovery but is waiting on an offer.  Atty. Klein requests a futher proceedings date in about 45-60 days. Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from New Lisbon Correctional for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Atty. Jessica Klein.

Order to Withdraw as Counsel signed by Judge Lau 05/11/2022. 
NOTE:  Incorrect name of defendant and case number listed.
Hearing on June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:38 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Juan A Aleman in court by Zoom video means, in custody at New Lisbon Correctional, with attorney Osman A Mirza.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan A Aleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court notes there is a motion to withdraw as counsel.  Atty. Mirza confirms and is asking the court to grant the motion.  Court inquires if the defendant has any objection to Atty. Mirza withdrawing as counsel.  Defendant does not understand why his attorney is asking to withdraw.  Court outlines the motion on the record for the defendant.  Defendant has no objection to the request.  Court will grant Atty. Mirza's motion to withdraw as counsel.  Court will have the PD's office appoint new counsel and will adjourn for status of counsel.  Defendant to appear by video from New Lisbon Correctional for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for May 13, 2022.
Proposed order to withdraw counsel.

filed by Atty. Osman A. Mirza;
